speaker: Niles
text: That was a very childish prank.  Now you have ruined my coffee!  If you can't behave like adults you shouldn't be coming to a grown-up cafe!

speaker: Girl
text: It wasn't us!

speaker: Girl
text: Aren't you going to yell at them?

speaker: Niles
text: They'll have already heard me yell at you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, thank you for agreeing to meet me on such short notice, I swear I am in a full-blown crisis.

speaker: Niles
text: If you are talking about that garish belt, I have emergency suspenders in my car.

speaker: Frasier
text: It's not the belt!  My high-school reunion is tonight and you know my history.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, not this folderol again.

speaker: Frasier
text: It's not folderol!

speaker: Niles
text: It's folderol.

speaker: Frasier
text: It is not folderol!  Every time my reunion comes around, it coincides with a severe downturn in my life.  Five years ago Lilith divorced me; five years before that I was left at the altar; five years before that I fell face first into the poison ivy!  And here we are right on schedule, I'm freshly fired!

speaker: Niles
text: I still don't know why you even went that poison ivy year.

speaker: Frasier
text: The point is, in ten minutes I have an extremely important job interview - a job which I am eminently qualified for, but now I have no chance of getting.

speaker: Niles
text: How can you know that?

speaker: Frasier
text: Because destiny won't allow it!  Destiny plans for me to walk into that reunion this evening the way I always do, the class loser!  Pitied and shunned by everyone until I end up sitting with the most pathetic people there.

speaker: Niles
text: You mean... the chess club?

speaker: Frasier
text: Worse!  The chess club's barbershop quartet.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, the Checkmates!

speaker: Frasier
text: I swear to God, I feel like I have a curse on my head!

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, you are a man of science.  You know curses don't exist.  There's a perfectly rational explanation for all of this.  You tripped and fell into the poison ivy; your radio station changed formats; your wife didn't love you.

speaker: Frasier
text: If this is a pep talk, would you kindly segue way to the peppy part?

speaker: Niles
text: The only reason why you're giving credence to this curse mumbo-jumbo is because you're nervous about your job interview.  You're an intelligent man, any station would be lucky to have you, wouldn't they?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, I suppose.

speaker: Niles
text: You must stop doubting yourself.  You deserve that job, so go out there and get it.  In an hour's time it'll be yours, and after a short trip to the store to return that belt, you will thoroughly enjoy your reunion.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you're right, Niles.  I should think positive.  This interview will go just fine and so will this evening.  All I have to do now is get a date - where the hell am I going to find a woman who's so desperate for an evening out she'd agree to go to someone else's reunion?

speaker: Roz
text: [_enters_] Hello, Frasier.

speaker: Niles
text: See, your luck's changing already! **BEST HAIR**  _Scene Two - KJMC Radio Station. Frasier arrives at the reception behind which Mr. Rugley is standing._

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, excuse me, I'm looking for Stephen Rugley's office.

speaker: Rugley
text: Well, you've come to the right place.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, splendid.  Is it possible for you to fetch me a coffee before my interview?

speaker: Rugley
text: Well, er...

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, better yet, make it a cup of Chamomile tea, a squirt of lemon and a full teaspoonfull of honey.

speaker: Rugley
text: We'll try to get that for you as soon as my assistant gets back.  Er, I'm Stephen Rugley. President of KJMC.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_laughs_] Lord, it's nice to meet you.  I'm terribly sorry.

speaker: Rugley
text: All right Dr. Crane - it's a great suit, by the way.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you.

speaker: Rugley
text: You're....

speaker: Frasier
text: I know, it's a bit risky.  People have been commenting on it all day.  _Frasier lets his jacket open, showing off his belt and we see that Rugley was in fact commenting on his open fly._

speaker: Frasier
text: It makes a bold statement, but frankly I like it!  I came through the park on the way over here and it caught the eye of many a young lady!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh God, my fly!  I thought you were talking about my belt.

speaker: Rugley
text: Well, shall we start the interview?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, good.  We haven't started yet!  Well...

speaker: Rugley
text: I'm glad you could make it, Dr. Crane.  I've enjoyed your work.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, that's very gracious of you, Mr. Ugly. [_realises what he said:_] Oh, dear God, I just said...

speaker: Rugley
text: What do you mean?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I just said your name right now and it sounded like I called you Mr. Ugly.  I assure you it won't happen again. It's just a matter of seperating the r's. [_practicing:_] Mr. Rug, Mr. Rug, Mr. Rug...  _Mr. Rugley looks up from his desk, his hair has been muffled and we can see that he is wearing quite an obvious toup ee._

speaker: Frasier
text: ...ley.  Mr. Rugley.

speaker: Rugley
text: Anyway, I think you might be a good fit here.  We need to find a replacement for Dr. Wendy.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?

speaker: Rugley
text: Yes, we didn't feel it was quite right to keep her on any longer.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, let me say I applaud your judgement on that score.  I mean, frankly, Dr. Wendy's saccharine style - it may be very popular, but you know, it's really not up to your standards, is it?!

speaker: Rugley
text: Dr. Wendy's my mother.  She's quite ill.

speaker: Assistant
text: Can I interrupt?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, please!

speaker: Assistant
text: You have some messages.

speaker: Rugley
text: Excuse us for a moment?

speaker: Frasier
text: Of course.

speaker: Assistant
text: Mr. Jaminson has to cancel.

speaker: Rugley
text: Oh, very well.  Why don't you call Phyllis Monderat and she if she can reschedule.

speaker: Rugley
text: Oh, and see if you can pick up my car from the shop.

speaker: Assistant
text: I already did.  It's across the street.  Somebody parked this BMW in your space.

speaker: Rugley
text: Well, have it towed!

speaker: Assistant
text: I already made the call.  _Frasier, upon hearing this, accidentally snaps the giraffe into two. He tries to put it together and replace it unsuccessfully._

speaker: Rugley
text: Dr. Crane?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_facing away:_] Yes?

speaker: Rugley
text: We don't have any tea, but would you like some coffee?

speaker: Frasier
text: That'll be splendid, yes, thank you.  _As Rugley pours the coffee, Frasier tries to hide the broken giraffe parts under his arms, which means he has to walk weird to get the coffee.  Upon picking up the cup he drops the head._

speaker: Rugley
text: What was that?

speaker: Frasier
text: Nothing.

speaker: Rugley
text: [_sees second bit drop:_] Is this my giraffe from my cabinet?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, it is.  I'm sorry, I was admiring it and it broke apart in my hands.  But you know, if your child is anything like mine, he'd be delighted to make you a new one!

speaker: Rugley
text: Actually, my father made it after his stroke.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I think you've got enough to go on.  It was lovely meeting you.  _He goes to shake Rugley's hand but inadvertantly knocks the freshly brewed coffee into Rugley's lap.  He screams with the heat._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well I'm going to have to rush if I'm gonna beat that tow-truck.  _Frasier runs out leaving Rugley to clean up the mess.  FADE TO:_  **CUTEST COUPLE**  _Scene Three - Frasier's Apartment. Niles is in the lift and just about to go up to Frasier's floor when Martin comes rushing in with Eddie in a shopping trolley._

speaker: Martin
text: Hold the elevator, Niles.  Thanks.

speaker: Niles
text: Hi, Dad. [_the doors close_]

speaker: Martin
text: I'm never going to that grocery store across the street again. They gave me such a hard time just because I brought Eddie in.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, it's not exactly sanitary, dad.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh yeah?  Well, when they get rid of the guy with pinkeye who's handing out cheese samples, then they can talk to me about sanitary.

speaker: Niles
text: [_notices trolley is full of dog food:_] Didn't you bring home a case of dog food yesterday?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah!  It was the economy stuff, he wouldn't touch it, so I've got to take all of it back.  This is his favorite kind.

speaker: Niles
text: [_looks at it:_] Well, I guess what they say is true: Once you've tasted animal by-products you can't go back to the cheap stuff!  Hey, will you pick the restaurant for tonight?

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, I've got a better idea than that!  My old precinct's having one of their seized property auctions down at the fairgrounds.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, what's the better idea?

speaker: Martin
text: Come on, Niles, these drug dealers have some pretty nice stuff!

speaker: Niles
text: I guess I've been searching for a wide-brimmed purple velvet hat... It's not quite, er, me.

speaker: Martin
text: I tell you what, we'll just go for a little while and then we'll come back here for dinner.

speaker: Daphne
text: Am I glad you're home.

speaker: Martin
text: What's wrong?

speaker: Daphne
text: Dr. Crane!  Ever since he came back from his job interview he seemed awfully depressed.  In fact, he's as bad as I've ever seen him!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, I guess it didn't go well.

speaker: Daphne
text: I gather not.  He mumbled something about it being worse than the Dresden premiere of Schumann's Second Symphony.

speaker: Niles
text: [_alarmed:_] And you left him alone?! _Niles begins madly prancing around the living room and rushes to the corridor to Frasier's room._

speaker: Daphne
text: He's in the kitchen!

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier! _Startled, Frasier bangs his head on the oven before coming out with the cleaning utensils he has been using.  He is wearing a scruffy T-shirt and is covered in dirt and grime._

speaker: Niles
text: Oh my God!  Frasier, are you all right?

speaker: Frasier
text: I was fine before you screamed, what the hell's wrong with you?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, Daphne said you were depressed and here you are with your head in the oven.

speaker: Frasier
text: I was cleaning it, Niles.  It's electric.

speaker: Frasier
text: If I wanted to end my life I'd choose something faster than broiling.

speaker: Martin
text: Sorry your interview didn't go well, Fras.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, it's alright, Dad.  You know, things don't work out the way we'd like them to sometimes. [_watches Daphne push the trolley by with Eddie in_] Much like my strict, "No shopping trolleys in the apartment policy."

speaker: Martin
text: Don't worry about it.  I'll take it back, but I need to return all that cheap dog food.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, Dad, I'm going down to pick up some cleaning supplies, I'll do it.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I thought you needed to get ready for the reunion?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh God, no, I'm not going!

speaker: Martin
text: Why?

speaker: Frasier
text: Because I'm cursed.  If I wasn't convinced before today's interview, I certainly am now.

speaker: Martin
text: But you haven't even heard anything.  For all you know you might have gotten it. [_doorbell sounds_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Believe me, dad.  I have a better chance of being crowned "Miss Teen USA."  _Frasier opens the door to Roz, who is dressed elegantly in a long black dress, has her hair done up and beautiful makeup across her face._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, dear God!

speaker: Roz
text: [_about Frasier's dress:_] Well, just how casual is this thing tonight?

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, I'm so sorry, I completely forgot to call and tell you that, well, we're not going!

speaker: Roz
text: Wait a second!  I found a babysitter at the last minute.  I got a new dress, I got Michelle to do my hair and just spent the last hour listening to the Estee Lauder lady describing her bladder operation just so I could get a free makeover. And now you're saying we're not going?

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, I can't go.  You see, I have a curse on my head.

speaker: Roz
text: What curse?

speaker: Niles
text: He thinks the Fates are conspiring to humiliate him at every reunion.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh come on, you don't really believe that, do you?

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, let's examine the evidence.  Daphne, would you assist me, please? [_hands her a paper:_] This is my school newsletter.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_reads_] The Bryce Academy Crier!

speaker: Niles
text: Which, coincidentally, was Frasier's nickname the first year he was there.

speaker: Frasier
text: Go to page eight!  Scott Alexander, what's he been up to?

speaker: Daphne
text: Wife, kids, has his own computer software business.

speaker: Frasier
text: Patsy Curds.

speaker: Daphne
text: Mother of three, successful physician, has invented a drug that may aid in the treatment of cancer.

speaker: Frasier
text: Won't they go green with envy when I top them all with this story of my life: Frasier Crane, unattached, unemployed and living with his father.  He spends his days scrubbing his oven and is anxiously awaiting his upcoming tooth cleaning.

speaker: Martin
text: Now, now, Frasier.  Everyone has their ups and downs.  You know, for all we know that cure for cancer didn't pan out either.

speaker: Niles
text: [_gives Martin a look, then deadpan:_] One can only hope, Dad.

speaker: Daphne
text: I bet if you just went in there with a sunny attitude, you'd have a good time.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, I tried sunny last time, you know where it got me? Table 97, singing "Goodbye my Coney Island Baby" with the Checkmates.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, maybe this time will be different.

speaker: Frasier
text: That's the mistake I always make.  Thinking that this year it will be different, that I can beat the curse.  Well, that's because it makes you think you can beat it but you can't! So, Roz, I apologize, I'll make this up to you some day. But right now, I'm going to go down to the store and run a little errand for my friend Eddie!  And then I'm coming back home and spending the evening with Daphne, doing some light housework and listening to my new psychoanalysis tape: "Depression, Anxiety and Death" as read by the author himself, Stanislav Monk.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_half in tears:_] Now who's cursed?!  _Daphne throws down the newsletter and retreats to her room.  END OF ACT ONE (Time: 12:00)  ACT TWO_  **MOST LIKELY TO SUCCEED**  _Scene One - Exterior Of Supermarket. Frasier wheels his trolley of cans up and sees a man throwing cans into the bin._

speaker: Frasier
text: Excuse me, sir, there's a place to recycle those cans right over there. Man: Oh, I know. [_puts them in and walks off_]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_angry:_] On behalf of Mother Earth, I thank you!  _Frasier begins to pick out the cans from the bin and put them in his trolley._

speaker: Frasier
text: That's the sort of person who drinks chocolate soda.  _Frasier carries on fumbling about in his scrappy T-shirt and covered in muck, as a man dressed in a tuxedo looks on and realises who he is._

speaker: Percy
text: Frasier Crane.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes. [_realises:_] Percy Williams, ho-ho, good to see you. I suppose you're on your way to the reunion.

speaker: Percy
text: Yes, yes I am.

speaker: Frasier
text: I couldn't make it this year myself.  A little too much on my Plate, things have gotten crazy.

speaker: Percy
text: I see there, I heard you went off the radio.

speaker: Frasier
text: You did?

speaker: Percy
text: You know, my wife heads up a charity that helps get homeless people back on their feet.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, I know.  The Scrap Foundation, it's very popular in my circle.

speaker: Percy
text: You should call, they could help you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Me? [_realises and laughs_] Oh, that's very funny.  The shopping cart with all the dog food.  I'm afraid you're suffering from the wrong impression.

speaker: Percy
text: Dog food?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, it's not mine.  It's my father's.

speaker: Percy
text: Oh, Frasier...

speaker: Frasier
text: No, really, you're mistaken: I'm not homeless.  I live in that luxury building right there. [_Percy obviously doesn't believe him_] Number 1901.

speaker: Percy
text: Frasier, take this. [_hands him money_]

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't need it.  I drive a BMW, I collect African art.

speaker: Percy
text: You always were a proud one.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm not proud.

speaker: Percy
text: Then take it!  For God sakes, spend it on food.

speaker: Frasier
text: I just threw out a $200 belt! **CLASS CLOWN**  _Scene Two - Frasier's Apartment. It is raining outside and Daphne is sat reading a book.  The doors open and Martin enters._

speaker: Daphne
text: Hey, how was the police auction?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, you didn't miss anything.  Especially when it started raining. _Niles, however, comes in with a gleeful smile on his face and carrying brown paper bags._

speaker: Niles
text: I made out like a bandit! [_laughs at the pun_] Those drug lords have the most incredible taste: Christophle, silver, Limoges. Oh, Morivors chrystal.  If I ever get married again, I'm going to register there.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, all.

speaker: Niles
text: I thought you were staying home?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, not any more.  I ran into Percy Williams down at the grocery store.  He mistook me for a street person.  If I don't get down there and defend myself he'll be passing around that rumor along with the Swedish meatballs.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, I'm glad you're going, Dr. Crane.  You'll have a nice time, and you look great.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you.  _Frasier opens door to a rather angry Roz who is dressed in the same stuff, but this time it seems more rushed and her hair is out of place._

speaker: Roz
text: You have no idea how big you owe me!

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes I do, Roz, and I will never ask you for another favor again - except could you possibly do something with your hair?  It seems to be leaning.

speaker: Roz
text: Frasier, when you called I was in the tub with a pint of Ha�gen-Daaz - considering that was fifteen minutes ago I think I look pretty good.

speaker: Frasier
text: I appreciate it, Roz, I really do.  Daphne, could you please help Roz getting finished?

speaker: Roz
text: I am finished.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, no, finish more.  And... remember what I told you.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh yeah, right: I'm a model-slash-doctor-slash-daughter of the Duke of Luxembourg.

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes, come along, Your Grace.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, are you actually so desperate that you're trying to impress those people by having Roz pretend to be some sort of trophy girlfriend?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_correcting:_] Trophy duchess!  Niles, it's the only way to beat the curse.

speaker: Niles
text: You can beat the curse by not going.

speaker: Frasier
text: I tried that, Niles, you see where that got me.  The curse found a way to humiliate me _in absentia_.  I've got to get down there.

speaker: Niles
text: Why?  To win the approval of some virtual strangers.

speaker: Frasier
text: I know it sounds foolish, Niles...

speaker: Niles
text: No, it's not foolish.  It's human.  I think it's all about the feelings of inferiority you've been carrying with you since high school.  That's the real curse.  Only, you're not the Bryce Crier anymore, you're a successful man.  You have an opportunity for real growth here.  Not by trying to impress these people, but by realizing that they don't matter anymore.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Roz, you look beautiful!

speaker: Roz
text: Thank you.

speaker: Frasier
text: But we're not going!

speaker: Roz
text: What?!

speaker: Frasier
text: It's got something to do with my personal growth.  You see, I don't care about these people anymore and you know, I want them to know it.

speaker: Roz
text: Frasier, I hired a babysitter twice, I did my makeup twice, I performed a miracle of engineering by taping myself into this dress twice - only to be stood up twice!

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, technically you only did your hair once.

speaker: Roz
text: [_shouts_] Shut up! [_hits him with her handbag_] You know, some day you're gonna need another favour from me, buddy, and when that day comes, I hope you know what you can do with it.

speaker: Frasier
text: I have a pretty good idea.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, do it twice!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, that was something.

speaker: Niles
text: Please, you call that a tantrum?  Maris used to do that once a week.  The poor thing needed help slamming the door!

speaker: Martin
text: [_enters:_] Frasier, I was just talking to Duke on the phone and your agent flicked in.  She was calling from a pay phone and she couldn't really talk, but she said that KPOV wants you to host your own show for them.

speaker: Frasier
text: My own television show!

speaker: Daphne
text: On KPOV! [_they all congratulate him_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you, all.

speaker: Niles
text: I just realised.  This is an even bigger opportunity for personal growth.  Having a prestigious new job like this and not even going to the reunion to boast about it!

speaker: Frasier
text: It's a great opportunity, isn't it!

speaker: Niles
text: Have a good time.

speaker: Frasier
text: I will.  _Frasier exits via the front door as Martin and Niles sit. Daphne exits to the kitchen._

speaker: Niles
text: I must say, Frasier did have a run of bad luck this week. I'm certainly glad it worked out better for him.

speaker: Martin
text: No, he didn't really get a call, I just made it all up.

speaker: Niles
text: His agent didn't call?

speaker: Martin
text: No, I just wanted to give the guy something to brag about.

speaker: Niles
text: Dad, I know you were trying to help, but don't you think that's a little risky?  What if somebody at the reunion knows it's not true?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, no, you worry too much.  Who's gonna know?  I mean most of these people are from out of town, they've probably never heard of KPOV!

speaker: Daphne
text: I knew it!  When you said KPOV, I thought it sounded familiar and it's right here in Dr. Crane's newsletter.  His classmate, Calvin Gurdstone, was just made station manager.  Won't that be nice for them; they'll be working together now. [_exits to kitchen again_]

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, my God!

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, come on, it'll be all right, don't worry about it.  This Gurdstone probably won't even show - he's just got a new job, he's probably real busy.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, you're right.  I musn't assume the worst.  I'm acting like Frasier, as if there really is a curse.

speaker: Daphne
text: Look here, he's also serving as this year's reunion coordinator. _Niles and Martin look at each other in horror as a flash of lightning finishes off the scene.  FADE TO:  Scene Three - Reunion Hall. Everybody is laughing and joking.  However, when Frasier arrives they walk away.  He goes to several tables but they all look away from him. So, he sits with the Checkmates:_

speaker: Frasier
text: Hi, fellas.

speaker: Checkmate
text: Hi.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hit it. _A harmonica is played then they begin singing.  Frasier takes the bass part._

speaker: Checkmate 1
text: Hello...

speaker: Checkmate 2
text: Hello...

speaker: Checkmate 3
text: Hello...

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello...

speaker: Checkmates
text: Goodbye, my Coney Island baby, Farewell, my own true love, true love-

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, honey!

speaker: Checkmates
text: I'm gonna go away and leave you, Never to see you any-

speaker: Frasier
text: Never gonna see you any-

speaker: Checkmates
text: I'm gonna sail upon that ferry boat...
